translations.hex.builtin.achievement.starting_out.cra: Crash ImHex for the first time.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.starting_out.doc: Open the documentation by selecting Help -> Documentation from the menu bar.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.starting_out.ope: Open a file by dragging it onto ImHex or by selecting File -> Open from the menu bar.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.starting_out.sav: Save a project by selecting File -> Save Project from the menu bar.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.selec: Select multiple bytes in the Hex Editor by clicking and dragging over them.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.creat: Create a bookmark by right-clicking on a byte and selecting Bookmark from the context menu.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.open_: Open a new view by clicking on the 'Open new view' button in a bookmark.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.modif: Modify a byte by double-clicking on it and then entering the new value.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.copy_: Copy bytes as a C++ array by selecting Copy As -> C++ Array from the context menu.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.hex_editor.creat: Create a IPS patch for the use in other tools by selecting the Export option in the File menu.
Fill a region with a byte by selecting Fill from the context menu.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.patterns.place_m: Place a pattern of any built-in type in your data by right-clicking on a byte and using the 'Place pattern' option.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.patterns.load_ex: Load a pattern that has been created by someone else by using the 'File -> Import' menu.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.patterns.modify_: Modify the underlying bytes of a pattern by double-clicking its value in the pattern data view and entering a new value.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.patterns.data_in: Create a custom data inspector entry using the pattern language. You can find how to do that in the documentation.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.find.find_string: Locate all strings in your file by using the Find view in 'Strings' mode.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.find.find_specif: Refine your search by searching for occurrences of a specific string by using the 'Sequences' mode.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.find.find_numeri: Search for numeric values between 250 and 1000 by using the 'Numeric Value' mode.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.data_processor.p: Place any built-in node in the data processor by right-clicking on the workspace and selecting a node from the context menu.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.data_processor.c: Connect two nodes by dragging a connection from one node to another.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.data_processor.m: Preprocess the displayed bytes by using the built-in Read and Write Data Access nodes.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.data_processor.c: Create a custom node by selecting 'Custom -> New Node' from the context menu and simplify your existing pattern by moving nodes into it.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.misc.analyze_fil: Analyze the bytes of your data by using the 'Analyze' option in the Data Information view.
translations.hex.builtin.achievement.misc.download_fr: Download any item from the Content Store

translations.hex.builtin.popup.error.file_dialog.comm: An error occurred while opening the file browser: {}
translations.hex.builtin.popup.error.file_dialog.port:
There was an error while opening the file browser: {}.
This might be caused by your system not having a xdg-desktop-portal backend installed correctly.

On KDE, it's xdg-desktop-portal-kde.
On Gnome, it's xdg-desktop-portal-gnome.
Otherwise, you can try to use xdg-desktop-portal-gtk.

Reboot your system after installing it.

If the file browser still doesn't work after this, try adding
	dbus-update-activation-environment WAYLAND_DISPLAY DISPLAY XAUTHORITY
to your window manager or compositor's startup script or configuration.

If the file browser still doesn't work, submit an issue at https://github.com/WerWolv/ImHex/issues

In the meantime files can still be opened by dragging them onto the ImHex window!

translations.hex.builtin.setting.general.max_mem_file: Max file size to load into RAM

Small files are loaded into memory to prevent them from being modified directly on disk.

Increasing this size allows larger files to be loaded into memory before ImHex resorts to streaming in data from disk.

translations.hex.builtin.tools.euclidean_algorithm.de:
The Euclidean algorithm is an efficient method for computing the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two numbers, the largest number that divides both of them without leaving a remainder.

By extension, this also provides an efficient method for computing the least common multiple (LCM), the smallest number divisible by both.

translations.hex.builtin.tools.ieee754: IEEE 754 Floating Point Encoder and Decoder
translations.hex.builtin.tools.ieee754.description:
IEEE754 is a standard for representing floating point numbers which is used by most modern CPUs.

This tool visualizes the internal representation of a floating point number and allows decoding and encoding of numbers with a non-standard number of mantissa or exponent bits.
translations.hex.builtin.tools.ieee754.result.title: Result
translations.hex.builtin.tools.invariant_multiplicati:
Division by invariant multiplication is a technique often used by compilers to optimize integer division by a constant into a multiplication followed by a shift. The reason for this is that divisions often take many times more clock cycles than multiplications do.

This tool can be used to calculate the multiplier from the divisor or the divisor from the multiplier.
translations.hex.builtin.tools.name: Name

translations.hex.builtin.tools.permissions.setuid_err: User must have execute rights for setuid bit to apply!
translations.hex.builtin.tools.permissions.sticky_err: Other must have execute rights for sticky bit to apply!
translations.hex.builtin.tutorial.introduction.descri: This tutorial will guide you through the basic usage of ImHex to get you started.
ImHex is a Reverse Engineering Suite and Hex Editor with its main focus on visualizing binary data for easy comprehension.

You can continue to the next step by clicking the right arrow button below.
ImHex supports loading data from a variety of sources. This includes Files, Raw disks, another Process's memory and more.

All these options can be found on the Welcome screen or under the File menu.
Let's create a new empty file by clicking on the 'New File' button.
This is the Hex Editor. It displays the individual bytes of the loaded data and also allows you to edit them by double clicking one.

You can navigate the data by using the arrow keys or the mouse wheel.
This is the Data Inspector. It displays the data of the currently selected bytes in a more readable format.

You can also edit the data here by double clicking on a row.
This is the Pattern Editor. It allows you to write code using the Pattern Language which can highlight and decode binary data structures inside of your loaded data.

You can learn more about the Pattern Language in the documentation.
This view contains a tree view representing the data structures you defined using the Pattern Language.
You can find more tutorials and documentation in the Help menu.

translations.hex.builtin.view.hex_editor.menu.edit.pa: When pasting values into the Hex Editor View, ImHex will only overwrite the bytes that are currently selected. If only a single byte is selected however, this can feel counter-intuitive. Would you like to paste the entire content of your clipboard if only one byte is selected or should still only the selected bytes be replaced?
Note: If you want to ensure pasting everything at all times, the 'Paste all' command is also available in the Edit Menu!
translations.hex.builtin.view.hex_editor.name: Hex editor
translations.hex.builtin.view.highlight_rules.name: Highlight Rules
translations.hex.builtin.view.highlight_rules.help_te:
Enter a mathematical expression that will be evaluated for each byte in the file.

The expression can use the variables 'value' and 'offset'.
If the expression evaluates to true (result is greater than 0), the byte will be highlighted with the specified color.

translations.hex.builtin.oobe.server_contact.text:
Do you want to allow the communication with ImHex's Servers?


This allows performing automatic update checks and uploads of very limited usage statistics, all of which are listed below.

Alternatively you can also choose to only submit crash logs which help immensely with identifying and fixing bugs you might experience.

All information is processed by our own Servers and is not given out to any third-parties.


You can change these choices at any time in the settings.
translations.hex.builtin.oobe.tutorial_question:
Since this is the first time you are using ImHex, would you like to play through the introduction tutorial?

You can always access the tutorial from the Help menu.
